result.execSummary:
The defendant Lontonio Jermaine Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence. First 6 months straight time, remainder with Huber.

miscConds.notes: Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Random urine screens.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lontonio Jermaine Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Branch 37 on behalf of Branch 24: Order denying requested release privileges, signed and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for additional release privileges.
Bail Refund Packets
11/23/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

15A 041170

Re-applied money with DNA surcharge corrected to $250.00 gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 17 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.  First 6 months straight time, remainder with Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Extradition costs in the amount of $29.22 payable to the Milwaukee County Sheriff Department; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Lontonio Jermaine Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Lontonio Jermaine Smith in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Certified documents received and filed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Lontonio Jermaine Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on warrant, however State Public Defender's office did not appoint new counsel.  Case adjourned for return on warrant in Branch 22.  Return on warrant scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 08/11/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 11/16/2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not present, Court already issued a bench warrant.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail review, however defendant failing to appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but does not forfeit bail at this time.  Plea and sentencing date of 09/02/2015 at 8:30am will remain calendared in Branch 22.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 08/11/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Matter in Court on defense Motion to Suppress.
Sworn for the State: Officer Russell Ewert, Officer Bryon Downey. Exhibit #1 received. State rests. Defense rests. Court heard argument from both parties. Court denied defense Motion for all the reasons stated on the record. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/2/2015 at 8:30 am.
